author: KALB Digital Team
title: Pineville man arrested in connection with fire homicide investigation
text:
PINEVILLE, La. (KALB) - A suspect has been arrested in connection with a homicide and structure fire that happened in Pineville.
On March 30, the Rapides Parish Sheriff’s Office said it responded to the 300 block of Williams Lake Road in reference to a structure fire. There, deputies learned from the Holiday Village Fire Department that there was a dead person in the abandoned home.
Following an investigation by the Louisiana State Fire Marshal’s Office and autopsy, the death was ruled a homicide. The body was officially identified as Buster Evans, 68, of Pineville.
From its investigation, RPSO was able to pinpoint Philip Barry Felter , 64, of Pineville, as a suspect. He was taken into custody on April 11 and was booked for three counts of possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Philip Barry Felter (Rapides Parish Sheriff's Office) On April 16, RPSO said the State Fire Marshal’s Office booked Felter in connection with the structure fire on one count of simple arson, principle to simple arson, obstruction of justice-evidence tampering and conspiracy.
Then on April 24, RPSO said Felter was re-arrested for second-degree murder and unlawful disposal of human remains while in custody at the Rapides Parish Detention Center. His bond is at $1,230,000.
The investigation is still active. Anyone with information can contact Detective Matt Dauzat, Criminal Investigation Division, Kolin Substation, at 318-542-4409. Callers may also contact the Louisiana State Fire Marshal’s Arson Tip Line at 866-946-1097 or the Arson Tip Form at lasfm.org
